properties.Title: Sales Tax
properties.UserDescription:
20% of transaction value to be taxed from the seller of every trade, excluding sales from government property. If the seller is an employee of a company, the tax is actioned on the amount left untouched by the constitutional Company Income Scaling. If the initiating player is selling something but has only Self Improvement as a skill, then they are not taxed. 
There are three cases:1. the seller is neither an employee of a company nor a company himself. He pays 20% sales tax from his own pockets.2. the seller is a company itself. The company pays the reduced sales tax rate from the company's bank account.
3. the seller is an employee of a company. The company pays the reduced sales tax rate from the company's bank account.

properties.Title: Contract & WP Tax
properties.UserDescription: If a citizen completes a contract or work party, the client (= the one that posted the contract or work party) has to pay 20% of the payment as tax. If the client is an employee of a company, the reduced tax rate is taken, and it's taxed from the company instead.

Citizen.contextDescription:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Client</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Client</ecoicon>: The citizen who posted the work.

properties.Title: Rent Tax
properties.UserDescription:
Whenever a rent or move in fee is paid, the person receiving the payment gets taxed 20%. There are 3 cases too:1. the citizen is an employee of a company. The company pays 20% of the reduced amount.2. the citizen is a company. Same as above.
3. the citizen is not an employee and not a company. Then he pays 20% of the full amount.

When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PayRentOrMoveInFee">Earner</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PayRentOrMoveInFee">Earner</ecoicon>: The citizen or group who receive the payment.
